summary: This document is a financial statement from Deutsche Bank detailing the account activity of Jeffrey Epstein for the month of January 2019. It includes transaction details such as deposits, withdrawals, and transfers, highlighting significant outgoing transfers and the account balance at the end of the month.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

events.title: Account Balance Summary
events.description: The financial statement begins with a summary of the account balance as of January 1, 2019.

events.title: Significant Outgoing Transfer
events.description: A significant outgoing transfer of $7,000,000.00 to IberiaBank is recorded.

events.title: Incoming Transfers
events.description: Two incoming transfers totaling $770,009.42 are recorded on January 11.

events.title: Multiple Outgoing Transfers
events.description: Several outgoing transfers totaling $1,200,000.00 are recorded on January 29.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Qtr, Saint Thomas, US Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The document is a financial statement from Deutsche Bank for Jeffrey Epstein's account for January 2019.
Epstein's account had significant outgoing transfers, including a $7,000,000.00 transfer to IberiaBank.
Incoming transfers to Epstein's account included $100,000.00 and $670,009.42 on January 11.
The account balance fluctuated significantly throughout the month, with multiple ATM withdrawals and service charges.
Several individuals, including David Mitchell, Connie Mattes Goldberger, and Martin G. Weinberg, are noted in connection with financial transactions involving Epstein.
